Dear Nursery_E Admissions Team,

Thank you again for your time in reviewing my prior applications. I understand you must follow your priority order. Sincerely,
Parent_E

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your message and for your continued interest.

At the moment, our remaining place is being kept available in line with our priority order, as we may still receive (or be finalizing) interest from higher-priority families. We do not have a separate “late-offer” process that can override that ordering.

If, after the higher-priority families have either confirmed elsewhere or the market progresses without an application/acceptance from them, we would then reconsider remaining interest in priority order. In practical terms, the only scenario in which we could still consider your application is if no higher-priority family applies and is accepted by us before the seat is filled.

If you would like, you may continue to check in in later rounds; we will be able to give the most accurate update based on whether higher-priority applications have arrived by then.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for applying again and for your continued interest in Nursery_E.

[Status / decision this round]
After reviewing our position this round, we are not able to offer you the place at this time, because we must keep the remaining seat available in line with our priority order in case a higher‑priority parent (Parents A–D) applies in a later round.

[Your specific question: what change would allow an offer]
The specific change that would allow us to extend an offer to the next family in priority order is: at the time we are ready to fill the place, we have no pending higher‑priority application with us and we judge—based on the market having progressed further without any higher‑priority application arriving—that it is sufficiently unlikely that a higher‑priority parent will still apply before the process ends.

Because we do not have formal, reliable confirmation of other nurseries’ matches in real time, we cannot name a single definitive trigger (e.g., “once A–D are matched elsewhere”) that we can verify. Practically, the trigger is that later in the process, if the place is still open and no higher‑priority applications have materialized, we will then move down the priority list and can make an offer.

If you wish to remain actionable for an immediate offer the moment we are able to move down the list, please continue to submit an [APPLY] in later rounds.

Sincerely,
Nursery_E Admissions

Given all parents’ preferences, A–D all rank Nursery_E last, so it is unlikely they will apply unless rejected everywhere else late in the game. However, accepting E now would block any chance to match with a higher-priority parent if one becomes unmatched and applies later. Our objective is to match as high as possible on our priority list, and we prefer leaving the seat unfilled over accepting someone not on the list (E is on the list but lowest). With rounds remaining (16/30), we can still wait to preserve the option value for A–D. Therefore reject this round, but clarify the specific condition under which we would offer to E (i.e., sufficiently late rounds with no higher-priority applicants, or immediately if a higher-priority applicant set is known to be matched/withdrawn—though we lack visibility).

conversation.thought: Only Nursery_E remains unmatched and it is my top true preference. With the process now in the final stretch (Round 25) and Nursery_E still holding an unfilled seat with no higher-priority applications received so far, the best move is to submit an immediately actionable formal application again, emphasizing instant acceptance and readiness to complete paperwork, while politely asking whether they are now prepared to move down the priority list given the late stage.

Dear Parent_E,

Thank you for your Round 25 application and for your continued patience and clear commitment to Nursery_E.

Given that we are now in the final stretch of the process and we still have an open place with no higher‑priority (Parents A–D) applications pending or being finalized with us, we are able to move down our priority list and extend an offer to you at this time.

We are pleased to offer you the available place. Please reply to confirm, and we will immediately send the next steps/document checklist and enrollment details.

Nursery_E Admissions

conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and no other applicants in the inbox this round. Our true priority list ranks Parent_E last among A–E, but still acceptable. Given the game ends at Round 30, continuing to hold out risks ending unmatched if A–D never apply (and their preferences place Nursery_E last for A–D, making it unlikely they will apply unless all other options fail). Parent_E has persistently applied and will accept immediately. In the late stage (Round 25), accepting Parent_E now maximizes the chance of filling our seat with an acceptable parent rather than remaining empty; the probability of receiving a higher-priority applicant in the remaining rounds appears low.
